gurmukhi: biRj ky gÍwr Ajwn bsqR phr jwnq nhI ]bwkq qw qiRX Awn cIr pYnwey iqn qnY ]822]
transliteration: Brij Ke Gvaar Ajaan Bastra Pahar Jaanat Nahee|| Baakat Taa Triya Aan Cheer Painaae Tin Tanai||822||
translation: The ignorant gopas of Braja did not know the wearing of those clothes; the wife of the washerman came to get them wear the clothes.822.
Speech of king Parikshat addressed to Shuka:

gurmukhi: dY bru qw qiRX ko kiRSn mUMf rhY inhurwie ]qb suk so pUCXo niRpY kho hmY ikh Bwie ]823]
transliteration: Dai Bar(u) Taa Triya Ko Krishan Moondd Rahai Nihuraae|| Tab Souk So Poochhyo Nripai Kaho Hamai Kih Bhaae||823||
translation: Krishna bestowed a boon on wife of the washerman and nodding his head, he sat down; then the (king) Parikshat enquired from Shuka, “O sage! Tell me why it happened that Krishna sat down, nodding his head?”823.
Speech of Shuka addressed to the king:

gurmukhi: cqurwBuj ko br vwih dXo br pwie suKI rhu qwih khy ]hir bwk ky hovq pY iqnhUM Amrw pur kY Pl hY su lhy ]
transliteration: Chaturaabhuj Ko Bar Vaah(i) Dayo Bar Paae Soukhirahu Taah(i) Kahe|| Har(i) Baak Ke Hovat Pai Tinhoon Amraa Pur Kai Phal Hai Su Lahe||
translation: The four-armed Krishna blessed her with the boon of living in happiness; with the words of the Lord, the fruit of all the three worlds are obtained,

gurmukhi: bhu dY kr l`jq hoq bfo iem lok ey nIq ibKY hY khy ]hir jwn ik mY ieh Qor dXo iqh qy muMfIAw inhurwie rhy ]824]
transliteration: Bahu Dai Kar Lajjat Hot Bado Im Lok E Neet Bikhai Hai Kahe|| Har(i) Jaan Ki Mai Eh Thor Dayo Tih Te Mounndeeaa Nihuraae Rahe||824||
translation: But according to tradition, the great man after bestowing something, feels shy on thinking that he had bestowed nothing; Krishna also knowing this that he had bestowed less, repented by nodding his head.824.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky gRMQy DobI ko bD qw qiRX ko br dyq Bey ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Granthe Dhobiko Badh Taa Triya Ko Bar Det Bhae||
translation: End of the description of ‘the killing of the washerman and granting of boon to his wife’ in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of the salvation of the gardener

gurmukhi: bD kY DobI kO kiRSn kir qw qiRX ko kwm ]rQ Dvwie qb hI cly niRp ky swmuih Dwm ]825]
transliteration: Badh Kai Dhobikau Krishan Kar(i) Triya Ko Kaam|| Rath Dhavaae Tab Hichale Nrip Ke Saamuh(i) Dhaam||825||
translation: After killing the washerman and bestowing boon on his wife, Krishna caused the chariot to be driven and reach in front of the palace of the king.825.
